content: You highlight attractive qualities of Christianity, such as being kind to someone who’s been a jerk to you. I’m an atheist and this point reminded me of one of the things I feel about any religion that teaches good morals such as this is. I feel I don’t need a religion to tell me how to be a good person. I believe I was born a good person with good morals, reinforced by how my non-religious parents brought me up. Being kind to others and treating them how I want to be treated comes naturally to me. I don’t do it because I’m following the rules of a religion that tell me I should do it. That’s one reason that Christianity would feel irrelevant to me — by telling me to behave how I would naturally behave anyway.
